oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Initial sintering kinetics of titanium-titanium nitride nano/nanocomposite powders
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DABHADE, VV
MOHAN, TRR
RAMAKRISHNAN, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: simulations
behavior
nano/nanocomposites
sintering kinetics
activation energy
volume diffusion
grain boundary diffusion
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The present investigation deals with the mass transport mechanisms operating during the initial sintering of titanium-titanium nitride nano/nanocomposite powders. Two compositions of the nano/nanocomposite powders, i.e. nano Ti-8 wt-% nano TiN and nano Ti-15 wt-% nano TiN along with nano Ti were used in the present study. Sintering studies have been carried out by dilatometry of the powder compacts using a constant rate of heating (CRH) and employing model equations to the initial sintering portion. The shrinkage values obtained were analysed using Young and Cutlers equations and a model proposed by Johnson and Berrin. Based on the analysis of experimental data the effect of second phase TiN on the mass transport mechanisms of nano Ti was determined.
